0420/A0/04/003/001.status_value: Only 2 countries (Anguilla and Trinidad) engaged in interventions to address bullying. Anguilla also held a multi-stakeholder meeting to devise a comprehensive strategy to address bullying.  In Trinidad 246  students were reached through the Respect Me Respect you Anti-bulling intervention. 0420/A0/04/003/002.status_value: All countries continued public awareness of CSA through the BTS media campaign. Trinidad reached about 80% of its population though their carnival child abuse ads. Some countries did  sensitization workshops for various members of the public. St Vincent and the Grenadines for example  reached about 66% of its parents. In addition an opinion poll  conducted to ascertain Trinidadians `knowledge of CSA revealed that over 90% of men and women could identify actions that constituted Sexual abuse
0420/A0/04/003/002.indicator_name: % of men and woemn in 5 countries who have knowledge about what is child  abuse  how to prevent and how to respond
0420/A0/04/003/002.headline: The Eastern Caribbean continues to wrestle with incidences of sexual abuse and child neglect. Nevertheless significant strides continued to be made towards the better protection of children from pre-secondary school.

0420/A0/05/882/001.indicator_name: Countries that implement national protocols for the protection of children from violence  abuse and neglect
0420/A0/05/882/001.headline: As child protection service agencies come under ever increasing media and public scrutiny  countries have embraced the need for enhanced  coordinated multidisciplinary action by frontline workers in applying standardized child protection processes that can better assist them in making the most reliable decisions about cases.

0420/A0/05/882/001.indicator_name: Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Bejing Rules of Justice
0420/A0/05/882/001.headline: As child protection service agencies come under ever increasing media and public scrutiny  countries have embraced the need for enhanced  coordinated multidisciplinary action by frontline workers in applying standardized child protection processes that can better assist them in making the most reliable decisions about cases.

0420/A0/05/882/002.indicator_name: Key articles of the CRC (Art. 19  Art. 34 and Art. 38   Optional Protocol on the sale of children  child prostitution and child pornography and Optional Protocol on the involvement of children in armed conflict) dealing with violence  exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into the national legislation.
0420/A0/05/882/002.headline: Despite systemically slow legislative processes  a number of countries have new legislation enacted  Bills at an advanced stage in the approval process  and/or draft Bills under serious consideration to domesticate key CRC articles into national legislation.
